job_title: Social Service Coordinator in Red Bank, NJ
pros: The management is very supportive and responsive. Great Benefits
cons: Paid time off could be improved

pros: Residents and staff are awesome you work tons of overtime help out as much as you can stay weekends come in on time get good reviews and they dumb on you
cons: Corporate culture bad a lot of favoritism health expensive pay ok

job_title: Dietary Server & Cook in Pitman, NJ
pros: Loved helping the residents. Felt good to know so how much about them to help them.
cons: Management has no idea what's going on, rules only apply to certain ppl, too much drama behind the scenes, no communication, very under paided, very, very understaffed, and at times unsafe.

job_title: Community Life Associate in Pitman, NJ
cons: You are paid minimum wage to do way more than the job.

job_title: Sales Associate in Ocean City, NJ

review_title: Great and clean environment to work in!
job_title: Certified Medication Aide in Newton, NJ
pros: Devoted and Caring Staff members, Clean environment, supportive atmosphere, plenty of time to interact with residents, and enjoyable activities with residents
cons: Inadequate resident-to-staff ratios, managers are unaware of evening/night shift issues, under staffing, too many double shifts, and staff that do not care stay too long.

job_title: Associate Relations Manager in Neptune, NJ
pros: I worked for another senior living community for a one year period.  The statement " You don't know what you have until it's gone" certainly applied. When the chance to return to UMC arose I jumped at the opportunity.  UMC has procedures and policies in place to assure that all associates are treated with dignity and respect.  I feel privileged to work for a company that values my opinions and contributions.
cons: Since my return my role is primarily administrative.  I miss the daily interaction with the senior population.

job_title: Sales Counselor in Ocean City, NJ
pros: The Shores Community is the largest employer in Ocean City, NJ. There are ample opportunities for growth within the community; especially with hard work & dedication.  If you are naturally compassionate at heart and have a deep passion to help people, you will be right at home! This is one organization where the work, love & loyalty that you put forth each day will never go unnoticed.  Wonderful place to work.
cons: There are no cons when it comes to working for this faith-based, Nonprofit Organization.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Ocean City, NJ
pros: I am been employed at the Shores for over six years and I love it. I feel like I'm really a part of a team here, and I have a supervisor that cares about me as a person - not just an employee. And we just received a Great Place to Work Certification! I'm planning on working here until I retire.
cons: There are really no downsides to working here. Great atmosphere, great company benefits,

review_title: Overall good company to work for
pros: Competitive Pay, benefits better than most, caring organization, takes care of their residents
cons: Home office needs to understand what actually goes on in the communities. They do not fully think programs through prior to implementation and how they effect operations in the facilities.

job_title: Community Life Assistant in Newton, NJ
pros: I love working for UMC because It has a family atmosphere. I left UMC for another career opportunity and decide to come back because it is so great to be here. Working here has also helped me grow and achieve my professional goals in the industry.

job_title: Dining Room Server in Ocean City, NJ
pros: Great feeling to spend time with the seniors. Bosses are very accommodating with schedule and they let you do the job without hovering.
cons: Teamwork among coworkers could use improvement

pros: Great people who care about what they do. Great team chemistry. Wonderful benefits and pto system. We were also just recognized as A Great Place to Work, an honor only given to about 1,000 companies in the country!
cons: Computers we use could use some upgrades.

pros: Environment is good, crew is fun to work with and most of the residents are nice to work with that's all
cons: Can be boring at some points and some residents can be difficult to serve, some workers can be lazy and not help out

pros: big happy family atmosphere, will help in the time of need (personally)
